snippet: A service offered by two rabbis used cattle prods and other methods to motivate recalcitrant husbands, according to the Federal Bureau of Investigation.
abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation accuses Brooklyn Rabbis Mendel Epstein and Martin Wolmark of offering service to violently persuade men in some ultra-Orthodox Jewish communities in Brooklyn to grant divorces to their wives; authorities say pair used kidnapping and torture to motivate recalcitrant husbands, charging wives up to $10,000 for rabbinical decree permitting violence and $50,00 to hire others to carry out deed.

byline.original: By JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ
byline.contributor: Jon Hurdle and Alex Vadukul contributed reporting. Susan Beachy and Jack Begg contributed research.

lead_paragraph: A service offered by two rabbis used cattle prods and other methods to motivate recalcitrant husbands, according to the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

headline.main: U.S. Accuses 2 Rabbis of Kidnapping Husbands for a Fee
